intro: Patrinia gibbiferum, commonly known as the hairy patrinia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Patrinia gibbiferum is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
